titles.title: To amend the Agricultural Adjustment Act to exempt actions undertaken to administer a marketing order issued under such Act from the antitrust laws.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committee on Agriculture, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Risk Management and Specialty Crops.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Livestock, Dairy and Poultry.

bill.summary: 10/24/1997--Introduced. Amends the Agricultural Adjustment Act, reenacted with amendments by the Agricultural Marketing Agreement Act of 1937, to exempt agricultural marketing orders from antitrust laws.
